attributes.action: learn the lessons of Iraq and not to involve this country in any military action against Iran nor to support the actions of other countries in using a military option in the current negotiations with Iran.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We urge the government not to use acts of provocation as a pretext to become involved in supporting such action and to use all diplomatic and peaceful means to de-escalate any crisis that may arise.
• We urge this on the basis that military action against Iran would:
• Prove a catastrophe for the wider Middle East with Iran and perhaps its allies responding to any attack. 
• Turn Middle Eastern public opinion further against the West.
• Further alienate the Muslim and Iranian people within our communities. 
• Lead to grave humanitarian and health implications for the Iranian people.
• Endanger shipping through the Hormuz Strait which transports between 1/3rd - 1/5th of the world's oil supplies.
• Increase support for the hard line elements in the Iranian government and undermine pro democracy movements within Iran.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
